elements.title: 2022 French protests (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2022 French protests (pictured) against the rising cost of living have been called French president Emmanuel Macron's "stiffest challenge" since his re-election?

elements.title: Lavender Haze (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the TV series Mad Men inspired Taylor Swift's hit song "Lavender Haze"?

elements.title: ancient Roman tourist destination (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ancient Roman tourist destination of Baiae was infamous for its hedonism?

elements.title: What Hath God Wrought (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that What Hath God Wrought, the 2007 history of Jacksonian America written by Daniel Walker Howe, is dedicated to Andrew Jackson's "political nemesis" John Quincy Adams?

elements.title: revolted in 1919–1920 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that with the help of Turkish and Azerbaijani agents, Muslims in Armenia revolted in 1919–1920 and massacred over 10,000 Armenians?

elements.title: The Breakwater Light (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Breakwater Light was the first newspaper in the first town in the first state?

elements.title: Francisco de Terrazas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mexican poet Francisco de Terrazas was praised by Don Quixote author Miguel de Cervantes?

elements.title: Martin Wemyss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a young midshipman Martin Wemyss, arriving late at a function and using the wrong entrance, bumped into George VI and was invited to dance with the Princesses Elizabeth and Margaret?
